info.title: HDT API
info.description: The CDNetworks HDT API is a RESTful API that allows you to manage transports, retrieve reports, and download logs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to return. The default value is 10.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting position of the query in relation to the complete set of unpaginated items. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: transportName
parameters.description: Search transports by name. Support fuzzy search.

parameters.name: cName
parameters.description: Search by cName.

parameters.name: accessDomain
parameters.description: Search by access domain.

parameters.name: accessPort
parameters.description: Search by access port, an integer between 1 and 65535

parameters.name: targetDomain
parameters.description: Search by target domain.

parameters.name: targetPort
parameters.description: Search by target port, an integer between 1 and 65535

get.description: Returns the total traffic volume in bytes for all of the transports. Parameters allow you to specify a time period and an interval type.

parameters.name: datefrom
parameters.description: RFC3339 formatted date indicating the starting date . Example:  2013-01-01T22:30:00+08:00

parameters.name: dateto
parameters.description:
RFC3339 formatted date indicating the ending date . Example:  2013-01-01T22:30:00+08:00.
If the time range of datefrom and dateto is more than 366 days, it will return 'TimeRangeTooLarge' error.

parameters.name: interval
timezone
parameters.description: Timezone for the report data. It must be relative to UTC and specified in the format UTC+n where -12<= n <= 12.  For example, timezone=UTC-7 and timezone=UTC+8.  If the parameter is unspecified, the results will be in the UTC timezone. The default timezone is UTC+00.
An access domain or a list of access domains separated by comma.
parameters.name: accessDomain
transport
parameters.description: A transport id or a list of transport ids separated by comma

get.description: The API is to query the total request count for all of customer’s transports.  Parameters allow you to specify a time period, an interval type.

parameters.name: datefrom
parameters.description: RFC3339 formatted date indicating the starting date . Example:  2013-01-01T22:30:00+08:00

parameters.name: dateto
parameters.description:
RFC3339 formatted date indicating the ending date . Example:  2013-01-01T22:30:00+08:00.
If the time range of datefrom and dateto is more than 366 days, it will return 'TimeRangeTooLarge' error.

parameters.name: interval
timezone
parameters.description: Timezone for the report data. It must be relative to UTC and specified in the format UTC+n where -12<= n <= 12.  For example, timezone=UTC-7 and timezone=UTC+8.  If the parameter is unspecified, the results will be in the UTC timezone. The default timezone is UTC+00.

parameters.name: accessDomain
parameters.description: An access domain or a list of access domains separated by comma

parameters.name: transport
parameters.description: A transport id or a list of transport ids separated by comma

Qtl-Request-Id.description: A string automatically generated by the API server to identify each request.

version.description: The version of the current API build. It’s format is ‘release-{yyyymmdd}’

artifact.description: The artifact of the current build.

name.description: The name of the API artifact.

group.description: The group name of current API build.

time.description: The date time when the current version is built.

value.message: Success

get.description: To get the current api version, including detailed build information.

transport.id.title: transportId
transport.id.description: Transport ID. It is a unique integer in the HDT system.

transport.code.title: transportCode
transport.code.description: It will be in "targetDomain:targetPort" form if transport type is "ipport", and in "userAccount" form if transport type is "vpn" or "socks5".

transport.type.title: transportType
transport.type.description:
Transport type, i.e., "ipport", "vpn" or "socks5".
For NG API, we only support ip-port transport.
This field is for internal use. For public, it is invisible and will be set to default value "ipport".

transport.targetDomain.title: targetDomain
transport.targetDomain.description: A domain or IP address referring to the origin server of your application. HDT will access this domain/IP address to get data from origin server. When transport type is "ipport", this parameter is valid and required. A domain name's length can be up to 256 characters.

transport.targetPort.title: targetPort
transport.targetPort.description: When transport type is "ipport", this parameter is valid and required. It must be an integer between 1 and 65535.

transport.useFtp.title: useFtp
transport.useFtp.description: Indicates whether to use ftp transport. 0 means false, 1 means true.

transport.cName.title: cName
transport.cName.description: The CNAME HDT generates for a transport. To accelerate using HDT, modify your DNS to point your access domain to this value.

transport.accessPort.title: accessPort
transport.accessPort.description: Access port of accelerated application for the public users. When transport type is 'ipport', the HDT API server will return an available access port. When applicationProtocol is "http", this parameter will be 80; when applicationProtocol is "sni" this parameter will be 443.

transport.useUdp.title: useUdp
transport.useUdp.description: Indicates whether to use udp transport. 0:TCP, 1:UDP.

transport.applicationProtocol.title: applicationProtocol
transport.applicationProtocol.description: Type of protocol that supports the port-sharing feature, such as "http", "sni". It is valid only for transport type "ipport".

transport.accessDomain.title: accessDomain

transport.status.title: transportStatus
transport.status.description: Status of this transport. 1 means "enabled", while 0 means "disabled".

transport.speedLimit.title: speedLimit
transport.speedLimit.description: Speed limit in "Mbps".It must be an integer between 0 and 1000. 0 means there is no limit. Default value is 0

transport.concurrentLimit.title: concurrentLimit
transport.concurrentLimit.description: Number of concurrent connections allowed for the transport. It must be an integer between 0 and 32768. 0 means there is no limit. Default value is 0.

transport.ipWhiteList.title: ipWhiteList
transport.ipWhiteList.description:
IP address white-list. Valid values are IP address, IP address segment, IP address range, or the combination of them separated by semicolons. Spaces, tabs or line breaks can only appear in front of or behind IP address. The default value is a blank string.
The version of IP in this list should keep the same with the one specified in field 'ipVersion'. If the field 'ipVersion' is empty, then IPv4 should be used by default.

For example:
valid:
 11.11.12.3/20; 2.3.4.5-2.3.4.10;
21.12.45.18

Invalid:
 11.11. 12.3/20;  2.3.4.5-2.3.
4.10;
21.12.45.18

transport.transportData.title: transport-data
transport.transportData.description: A container of "transportId", "transportCode", "transportType", "transportName", "status" and some other elements describing a transport.

transport.deployId.title: transport.deployId
transport.deployId.description: Indicates a transport configuration history ID. The ID is a unique integer to this transport.

report.flowReport.title: flow-report
report.flowReport.description: A container for traffic information. It contains one <records-count> child element, one <upload-summary> child element, one <download-summary> child element and zero or more <flow-data> child elements indicating volume at different times.

report.uploadSummary.title: upload -summary
report.uploadSummary.description: Total upload traffic volume in bytes for all records.

report.downloadSummary.title: download-summary
report.downloadSummary.description: Total download traffic volume in bytes for all records.

report.flowData.title: flow-data
report.flowData.description: A container of <timestamp>, <upload>, and <download> elements describing the traffic volume in bytes for a specified period of time.

report.timestamp.title: timestamp
report.timestamp.description:
The timestamp is in RFC3339 format and includes the offset from UTC.
If interval from request is "oneminute" or "fiveminutes", the format will be "YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:00", which indicates the end time of the interval.
If interval from request is "hourly", “daily”, or “monthly”, the format will be "YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:00", which indicates the start time of the interval.

report.upload.title: upload
report.upload.description: Upload traffic volume in bytes for a specified period of time.

report.download.title: download
report.download.description: Download traffic volume in bytes during a specified period of time.

report.requestsReport.title: requests-report
report.requestsReport.description: A container for request count information. It contains <records-count>, <total-summary>, <success-summary>, and <requests-data> for a specified period of time.

report.totalRequestsSummary.title: total-summary
report.totalRequestsSummary.description: Total number of requests for all records.

report.successRequestsSummary.title: success-summary
report.successRequestsSummary.description: Total number of successful requests for all records.

report.requestsData.title: requests-data
report.requestsData.description: A container of <timestamp>, <total>, and <success> elements describing the request data for a specified period of time.

report.totalRequestsCount.title: total
report.totalRequestsCount.description: Total number of requests during the time period.

report.successRequestsCount.title: success
report.successRequestsCount.description: Total number of successful requests during the time period.

response.status.title: status
response.status.description: 0 or 1 to indicate whether response contains error or not. If 1, the request is handled successfully, and the expected result will be contained in 'content' field. Else the 'message' field will show the error details.

response.message.title: message
response.message.description: Shows the result or error message of the request.

response.code.title: response.code
response.code.description: Response code. When the request is failed, it will show the error code. When succeed, "0" will be returned.

transport.carryClientIp.title: carryClientIp
transport.carryClientIp.description: One of transport advanced configurations. Specify 0 or 1 to indicate whether carry client ip. 0: false, 1: TCP Option 0x4e, 2: Proxy Protocol v1, 3: Proxy Protocol v2.

transport.hasPsb.title: hasPSB
transport.hasPsb.description: Indicates whether the access domain has PSB Beian in China. 0: false, 1: true.

transport.ipVersion.title: ipVersion
transport.ipVersion.description: Shows what IP version will be supported. 1: IPv4, 2: IPv6, 3: IPv4+IPv6.

transport.transportStrategy.title: transportStrategy
transport.transportStrategy.description:
Transport strategy.

Its value enumerations:
topspeed: Default,
interact: Interactive,
hugeslow: High Concurrency,
topquick: High Real-time,
uniform: Big File.

Default: Low cost and high efficiency.
Interactive: For applications requiring better response times, HDT internal routing is enabled in this mode.
High Concurrency: Suitable for small data transfers and high concurrency. Normally, concurrency is considered to be high when its value exceeds 1,000 connections and low when its value is below 100 connections.
High Real-time: Suitable for applications delivering small data with low concurrency (fewer than 100 connections) and requiring optimized response times.
Big File: For big file tranfer.

transport.dedicatedIpService.title: dedicatedIpService
transport.dedicatedIpService.description: Indicates whether to use dedicated IP Service, 1 means true while 0 means false. It can be set as true only when the application protocol of transport is other than 'http' or 'sni'.

transport.hasIcp.title: hasICP
transport.hasIcp.description: Indicates whether the access domain has ICP Beian in China. 0: false, 1: true.

transport.ipBlackList.title: ipBlackList
transport.ipBlackList.description:
IP address black-list. Valid values are IP address, IP address segment, IP address range, or the combination of them separated by semicolons. Spaces, tabs or line breaks can only appear in front of or behind IP address. The default value is a blank string.
The version of IP in this list should keep the same with the one specified in field 'ipVersion'. If the field 'ipVersion' is empty, then IPv4 should be used by default.

For example:
valid:
 11.11.12.3/20; 2.3.4.5-2.3.4.10;
21.12.45.18

Invalid:
 11.11. 12.3/20;  2.3.4.5-2.3.
4.10;
21.12.45.18

Date.name: Date
Date.description: The date and time of the request.

Content-Type.name: Content-Type
Content-Type.description: The format of request data, supports "application/json" and "application/xml", default value is "application/json".

Accept-Encoding.name: Accept-Encoding
Accept-Encoding.description: Compression format of response data, either "gzip" or "uncompressed". The default value is "uncompressed".

Accept.name: Accept
Accept.description: Response format, either "application/json" or "application/xml". The default value is "application/json".

Qtl-Request-Id.name: Qtl-Request-Id
Qtl-Request-Id.description: A string automatically generated by the API server to identify each request.

On-Behalf-Of.name: On-Behalf-Of
On-Behalf-Of.description: If you are a reseller, you can use this header to specify the ID of a child customer and make an API call on its behalf.

basicAuth.description:
All requests to CDNetworks' platform must be authenticated using an API login name and key assigned to your organization. For security, the API key is not passed directly but is secured as described below. 

The authentication type is HTTP Basic, and the authorization string is specified in the HTTP request header called Authorization.
```
#!/bin/bash
#URL of the CDN360 API server
API_SERVER=https://ngapi.cdnetworks.com

#You will be given the following information by the CDNetworks sales team
USER="{API user name}"
API_KEY="{API key (make sure to escape the $ sign if any)}"

#Date in RFC 1123 format
DATE=`date "+%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S %Z"`

#Generate the password. Raw output from openssl by adding the "-binary" flag
passw=$(echo -n "$DATE" | openssl dgst -sha1 -hmac "$API_KEY" -binary | base64)
echo " "

#Construct the curl command to query list of applications
apiCall ="curl -i --url '${API_SERVER}/hdt/v1/applications'
                  -X GET
                  -u $USER:$passw
                  -H 'Date: $DATE'
                  -H 'Accept: application/json'"
eval $apiCall
echo " "
```
 If you are a reseller, you can also specify a child customer's ID in an On-Behalf-Of HTTP header to make API calls to manage your child customer.

tags.name: Transports
tags.description: Call the Transports APIs to configure your HDT transports.

tags.name: Reports
tags.description: Call the Reports APIs to get information about the usage of your HDT transports.

tags.name: Info
tags.description: Call the APIs to get information about current API version.
